intro: Brachystele cycloglossa, commonly known as the slender-stemmed cycloglossa, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its small, compact growth habit and is typically found in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a thallus that is often covered in a layer of fine, filamentous structures. Its reproductive structures, called gametophores, are distinct and contribute to its identification. Brachystele cycloglossa is often used in botanical studies to understand the ecological roles of liverworts in forest ecosystems.
